Package edu.uiowa.cs.warp

Class ReliabilityAnalysis

java.lang.Object
edu.uiowa.cs.warp.ReliabilityAnalysis
public class ReliabilityAnalysis extends Object
ReliabilityAnalysis analyzes the end-to-end reliability of messages transmitted in flows for the WARP system.

Let M represent the Minimum Packet Reception Rate on an edge in a flow. The end-to-end reliability for each flow, flow:src->sink, is computed iteratively as follows:
(1)The flow:src node has an initial probability of 1.0 when it is released. All other initial probabilities are 0.0. (That is, the reset of the nodes in the flow have an initial probability value of 0.0.)
(2) each src->sink pair probability is computed as NewSinkNodeState = (1-M)*PrevSnkNodeState + M*PrevSrcNodeState
This value represents the probability that the message has been received by the node SinkNode. Thus, the NewSinkNodeState probability will increase each time a push or pull is executed with SinkNode as a listener.

The last probability state value for any node is the reliability of the message reaching that node, and the end-to-end reliability of a flow is the value of the last Flow:SinkNode probability.

CS2820 Spring 2023 Project: Implement this class to compute the probabilities the comprise the ReliablityMatrix, which is the core of the file visualization that is requested in Warp.

To do this, you will need to retrieve the program source, parse the instructions for each node, in each time slot, to extract the src and snk nodes in the instruction and then apply the message success probability equation defined above.

I recommend using the getInstructionParameters method of the WarpDSL class to extract the src and snk nodes from the instruction string in a program schedule time slot.

Version:
1.5
Author:
sgoddard

  • Field Details

    • program

      private Program program
      The program the analysis is being performed on.

    • e2e

      private Double e2e
      The required end to end communication reliability for the flows.

    • minPacketReceptionRate

      private Double minPacketReceptionRate
      Minimum packet reception rate for graph nodes.

    • numFaults

      private Integer numFaults
      The number of faults per edge in a flow.

    • nPushes

      private ArrayList<Integer> nPushes
      The number of pushes for each node and the worst case transmission time, used in numTxPerLinkAndTotalTxCost.

    • reliabilities

      private ReliabilityTable reliabilities
      A reliability table with the results of the reliability analysis. Rows in the table are the timeslots in the program schedule, and columns are each node in each flow, with the flows sorted by priority order.

    • schedule

      private ProgramSchedule schedule

  • Constructor Details

    • ReliabilityAnalysis

      public ReliabilityAnalysis(Double e2e, Double minPacketReceptionRate)
      Creates a new ReliabilityAnalysis object with the provided values for end-to-end communication and minimum packet reception rate. All other values are set to defaults.
      Parameters:
      e2e - The required end to end communication reliability for flows
      minPacketReceptionRate - The minimum packet reception rate for nodes

    • ReliabilityAnalysis

      public ReliabilityAnalysis(Integer numFaults)
      Creates a new ReliabilityAnalysis object with the provided values for the number of faults. All other values are set to defaults.
      Parameters:
      numFaults - The number of faults allowed per edge in a Flow

    • ReliabilityAnalysis

      public ReliabilityAnalysis(Program program)
      Runs a reliability analysis on the given program and stores it in the resulting object.
      Parameters:

      private void setDefaultParameters()

    • numTxPerLinkAndTotalTxCost

      public ArrayList<Integer> numTxPerLinkAndTotalTxCost(Flow flow)
      Calculates number of transmissions needed per link and total worst-case transmission time for the given flow.
      Parameters:
      flow - the flow being analyzed
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing the number of transmissions per link and the total worst case time of transmitting end to end at the end of the List.

    • nextRow

      private ReliabilityRow nextRow(ReliabilityRow prevReliabilityRow, double minLinkReliablityNeeded)
      Computes the next row in the reliability window.
      Parameters:
      prevReliabilityRow - The previous reliability row in the reliability window
      minLinkReliablityNeeded - The minimum reliability needed for each link in the path
      Returns:
      the next reliability row in the reliability window

    • getFixedTxPerLinkAndTotalTxCost

      private ArrayList<Integer> getFixedTxPerLinkAndTotalTxCost(Flow flow)
      Calculates the fixed number of transmissions per link based on the number of faults per edge and the total number of transmissions for the flow.
      Parameters:
      flow - the flow being analyzed
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing the number of transmissions for each node with the total number of transmissions at the end of the list

    • getReliabilities

      public ReliabilityTable getReliabilities()
      Returns a table with the results of the reliability analysis. Rows in the table are the timeslots in the program schedule, and columns in the table are each node in each flow, with the flows sorted by priority order.
      Returns:
      a ReliabilityTable with the results of the analysis

    • verifyReliabilities

      public Boolean verifyReliabilities()
      Verifies that the reliability requirement has been met for all flows in the current program.
      Returns:
      true if reliabilities have been met, false if not
